p: In conclusion, our results suggest that the mode of viral spread, global or local infection, may undergo adaptive evolutionary change in vitro and in vivo. In the future, we can consider more realistic situation such as evolutionary dynamics in three-dimensional space or the repulsion of superinfecting virions that attenuates self-shading effect [ 29]. In order to examine the emergence of mutant virus or the evolution of virulence, we need to take into account the fact that the mode of infection itself is subject to selection.
